revised_title: Investigation of Ni Ions in Irradiated and Crystals
tldr: The authors investigated the effects of ionizing radiations on Ni and Ni crystals using paramagnetic resonance methods. They found that when exposed to radiation, Ni ions trap electrons and form ions associated with various vacancy configurations. The study describes the annealing behavior of these complexes in room temperature and low-temperature irradiated crystals, as well as the symmetry of the complexes and their ground states. The fluorine hyperfine structure of the spectra is also investigated, providing insights into the environment of the Ni ions.
